DOC.brief_summary: Objective : The investigator study effect respiratory muscle stretch 8-week pulmonary rehabilitation program . Methods : This simple-blind parallel control trial , conduct out-patient clinic . Twenty six patient COPD ( mean age 68 ± 6 , percent predict FEV1 47 ± 16 ) randomize either respiratory muscle stretch group plus exercise training ( RMS ) , exercise train group ( Sham ) , 8-week exercise program 3 session per week . The investigator measure inspiratory expiratory muscle strength ( maximal inspiratory expiratory pressure - PIM PEM ) , exercise capacity ( 6-minute walk distance ) , dyspnea quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Respiratory Muscle Stretching Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD )
DOC.criteria: Subjects 40 75 year age refer physician Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program With clinical spirometric diagnosis moderate severe COPD accord Global Initiative Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease ( GOLD ) , stable condition ( without exacerbation infection least month ) Former smoker Patients known history asthma , severe and/or unstable heart disease Any pathological condition could impair physical activity
DOC.keyword: improve exercise capacity , dyspnea , quality life
